4.5.25  5:43 pm   Serious question: How can we balance sustainable space mining with interstellar alien minority protection?

4.5.25  4:26 pm   i get really pent up with emotion sometimes and really just want to sing/make some music. so i'll sit down and try to make something and like, it sounds fine, but doesn't quite scratch the itch y'know. never can i sit down and accurately create something that sounds like an embodiment of what i'm feeling. is the solution to this to just keep making music the way i have been until i get better, or should i be making conscious moves in order to improve?

4.5.25  8:13 am   do you think that someone could find meaning in your music the same way they would with and without a visual medium?
basically; is the video a core part of the song experience?

4.5.25  6:34 am   it feels like i can only do things if there are obvious defined parameters for success. it's tough for me to spend any time in the 'journey' without being obsessed with 'destination'. perfectionism, in other words. and it's making me miserable. but i feel like doing things just to experience doing them (i.e. being a person) is beyond me on my own. if i had a friend to do things with, that would be easier - but - something like going out to read a book in a park on a nice day sounds the exact same to me as eating a handful of dirt. my only reaction is "but why would i do that?" i feel joyless and trapped.

4.5.25  6:02 am   How do you stop overthinking whilst improvising?
Do you have times when nothing you play feels right? It obliterates my mood

this
4.4.25  5:15 am   When you write a song, do you write the sound effect too? Or you added it when you are making the song.

4.4.25  5:06 am   do you still have the full, unedited audio snippet of what came after the fade in "mount st. helens is about to blow up",

     or a .pdf document that shows what you wrote?

     because, i think about that part once in a while. i feel that you wrote something after that fade, it makes me intrigued about what is the true end of that song. with "true end" i mean the last note that appears in the sheet music for that song.

     also, how often do you deal with people asking you for very specific questions about your songs?

     i probably asked way too much, but works pretty well for the never-ending trivia on the website, i guess. still a big fan, and always will, thanks bill!
